snippet: Binge-viewing has become such a popular way for Americans to watch TV that it is changing the ways that networks create and distribute episodes.
abstract: Binge-viewing, empowered by DVD box sets and Netflix, is such a popular way for Americans to watch TV that it is changing how networks create and distribute series episodes; while most television is still watched live, ratings for some series double after week of recorded viewing is counted; Netflix is about to release drama expressly designed to be consumed in one sitting, streaming all 13 episodes of political thriller House of Cards at same time.
lead_paragraph: Binge-viewing has become such a popular way for Americans to watch TV that it is changing the ways that networks create and distribute episodes.

headline.seo: Netflix to Deliver All 13 Episodes of ‘House of Cards’ on One Day
headline.main: New Way to Deliver a Drama: All 13 Episodes in One Sitting
headline.print_headline: New Way to Deliver a Drama: All 13 Episodes in One Sitting
